events.title: The Hijra Begins
events.description: Prophet Muhammad and his followers begin their migration from Mecca to Medina, marking the start of the Islamic calendar.
events.significance: This event signifies the beginning of the Islamic calendar and the establishment of the first Muslim community.

events.title: Trinity Nuclear Test
events.description: The United States conducts the first successful detonation of an atomic bomb in the New Mexico desert at the Trinity site.
events.significance: The test marked the dawn of the nuclear age, influencing the outcome of World War II and global geopolitics.

events.title: Battle of Las Navas de Tolosa
events.description: Christian forces decisively defeat the Almohad Muslim rulers in Spain, turning the tide in the Reconquista.
events.significance: This battle was a major turning point that led to the decline of Muslim power in the Iberian Peninsula.

events.title: East-West Schism
events.description: The mutual excommunication between the Pope and the Patriarch of Constantinople formalizes the division between the Roman Catholic and Eastern Orthodox Churches.
events.significance: This event led to the permanent division of Christianity into Western and Eastern branches.

events.title: Neutrality Act Passed in the U.S.
events.description: The U.S. Congress passes the Neutrality Act of 1935 to prevent American involvement in future overseas wars.
events.significance: The act reflected U.S. isolationist policy prior to World War II.
